And therefore it is the mass market that determines the overall prices that farmers earn. Now tomato prices in Kenya. Ken be determined by weather, supply, demand and most of all the brokers will and grid. How much brokers want is what the farmer will sell simply because he cannot sell his own produce. At low cost especially when it comes to controlling pangodiseases caused by cold weather. The greenhouse system is ideal in both hot and cold regions as it enables faster growth of crops. The most profitable high yielding tomato varieties to grow in Kenya. In order to make money in tomato farming you must select the best tomato variety with faster maturity, high yield and good tolerance to diseases. All tomato varieties are not the same. They vary in terms of yield and resistance to diseases. The best two varieties that you can plant and get good high yields is terminated from raw seeds and also from semi-nist. These are the best and most profitable outdoor tomatoes to grow in Kenya. For greenhouse farmers, Susanaifwan has good shape, good size and therefore makes it the best tomato variety to plant inside greenhouse. It is a product of raw seeds. Now let's check what makes terminated fwan a good variety. One it is a very vigorous plant, long, determinate and a heavy yielder. Its fruit has deep color with over shape. It matures with 75 days from transplanting, has a fruit weight of 125 to 150 grams, a yield potential of 40 tons per acre. And those harvested fruits, they can stay up to 21 days fresh at room temperature. This is what makes it most ideal for buyers. They want a produce that can stay long after harvest.
